entry.title: the touch of your hand (says you'll catch me if ever I fall)
entry.summary:
Author: sulky_croissant

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,962Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 23

Summary: He closed his eyes.Bruce had stopped barely one full step past the doorway, but he was moving now, each step bringing him closer to Clark. With no outside sound to filter through, and with his eyes tightly closed, Clark's whole world finally narrowed entirely to Bruce. His surefooted steps. His steady breathing. The beautiful thrum of his heartsong, perfectly unique to him, perfectly composed and in control. The sound of ruffling fabric as he unbuttoned the cuffs of his sleeves and rolled them up.The feel of his callous-rough fingertips, gently reaching out to trace a path along Clark’s jawline.Clark shuddered at the touch, at the trail of fire left behind where Bruce’s fingers had slid across his skin. He wanted to lean into it desperately. He didn't.“I’m sorry,” he whispered instead. His chest ached.Bruce pressed his palm flat against Clark’s cheek. “I know,” he said. And then, “Red lights on.”Or: After a difficult case on another planet, Clark deals with his guilt by not sleeping or taking care of himself or talking to his partner. When it all comes crashing down, Bruce finally intervenes.Superbat Big Bang 2025!
